CatDescriptText: Mr. John Creighton, porter, North Side and Mrs. Martha Weaver, housewife, Knott Manor, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 37 with question: "Do you think the religious issue will play a major role in the selection of the Democratic party's nominee for the Presidency of the United States?" Mr. John Creighton's answer reads: "Everybody's thinking that way, because we've never had a Catholic President, it might play a pretty big part."  Mrs. Martha Weaver's answer reads: "We shouldn't have religion in politics.  The presidential candidate should be chosen solely on what he stands for."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Creighton wearing tweed zipper jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Martha Weaver wearing earrings and light colored coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
